title: Add Google Analytics tag (G-73VJ1TQ3D7) to all pages

requirements.summary: Inject the Google Analytics gtag.js snippet (tracking ID: G-73VJ1TQ3D7) into frontend/index.html immediately after the opening <head> tag, ensuring no duplicate tags exist.
acceptanceCriteria: The gtag.js script tag with src 'https://www.googletagmanager.com/gtag/js?id=G-73VJ1TQ3D7' appears as the first child of <head> in frontend/index.html.
The inline gtag configuration script (dataLayer, gtag('config', 'G-73VJ1TQ3D7')) follows immediately after the async gtag.js script tag.
No duplicate Google tag scripts exist anywhere in frontend/index.html.

All pages of the app (Home, Destinations, Packages, PlanTrip, Contact, Community, Admin, AdminLogin, DestinationDetail) load the Google Analytics tag since they all use the single index.html entry point.

file_operations.description: Remove any existing Google Analytics gtag.js script tags if present, then insert the two Google Analytics script tags immediately after the opening <head> tag. The first script tag should be '<script async src="https://www.googletagmanager.com/gtag/js?id=G-73VJ1TQ3D7"></script>'. The second should be an inline script initializing the dataLayer and calling gtag('config', 'G-73VJ1TQ3D7'). Ensure these are the first children of the <head> element, before any existing meta tags, link tags, or other scripts.
